REST API main¶

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserBase, user_login: UserLogin, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a new user for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserBase) – The data for the user to create.

  • user_logn – The user to create the user for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_birthday(db: Session)¶

Retrieves a list of users, who have birthday during the week

Parameters:

db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Retrieves a list of users or None

Return type:

User | None

async src.repository.users.get_user(user_id: int, user_login: UserLogin, db: Session) → User¶

Retrieves a single user with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user to retrieve.

  • user_login (UserLogin) – The user to retrieve the user for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

User | None

async src.repository.users.get_users(db: Session, user_login: UserLogin, info: str = None) → List[User]¶

Retrieves a list of users for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • info (string or None) – Information about user. First name, last name or email.

  • user_login (UserLogin) – The user to retrieve user for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of users.

Return type:

List[User]

async src.repository.users.remove_user(user_id: int, user_login: UserLogin, db: Session) → User | None¶

Removes a single user with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user to remove.

  • user_login (UserLogin) – The user to remove the user for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed user, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

User | None

async src.repository.users.update_user(user_id: int, body: UserUpdate, user_login: UserLogin, db: Session) → User | None¶

Updates a single user with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user to update.

  • body (UserUpdate) – The updated data for the user.

  • user_login (UserLogin) – The user to update the user for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

User | None

REST API repository Login¶

async src.repository.login.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Confirmed email for customer

Parameters:

  • email (str) – email by which we want confirmed

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

async src.repository.login.create_user(body: LoginModel, db: Session) → UserLogin¶

Create new customer for web site

Parameters:

  • body (LoginModel) – The data for the customer to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created customer

Return type:

UserLogin

async src.repository.login.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → UserLogin¶

Retrieves customer from email if it was create

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email by which we are looking for a customer

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

customer

Return type:

UserLogin

async src.repository.login.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → UserLogin¶

Update avatar for customer

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email customer’s which avatar we want update

  • url (str) – url avatar

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

info about customer

Return type:

UserLogin

async src.repository.login.update_token(user: UserLogin, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Update token for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • user (UserLogin) – The customer to update token for.

  • token (str | None) – The refreshed token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None
